instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Hi guys.

I have this <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> which is powering on normal but after 5min the picture goes crazy and the CPU overheats. The fan spins in the beginning but stops and doesn't go on again. The board is clean no liquid damage. I replaced the thermal paste just in case and also tried a new ssd with a new installation but gets stuck when counting. Any ideas?

Thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Found some small solder balls around caps on the Ram chips probably the CPU was overheating alot...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Once i log in to OS needs 20/30sec to loose picture... cpu done i think :D

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message:
Very likely CPU problem.
Just in case, test with other heatsink.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: Good idea i'll try  and update :D thanks

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>
threads.message: CPU issue i replaced the board :D Thanks
